7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:21): plus  compression... and  all on line actions + snapshots

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:22): get solaris express community release
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:22): can't wait until my company starts using it. I try to stay away from Solaris because of VxFS
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:23): recently, been learning more and more of it, so its not that bad...Solaris is a lot like Linux.

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:23): http://uadmin.blogspot.com/2006/05/why-zfs-for-home.html <-- great introduction on how to get started... if you have 3 or more like drives use raidz instead of mirror
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:24): jamesd: nice link
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:24): yeah 11,000 people thought so.. all on one day, it was a great day
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:25): hey, can root disks be ZFS? or just 'external' disks?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:25): you can hack  root on  zfs, but you have to manually install
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:26): and still need  a ufs disk to boot off of
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:26): still cool though
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:26): its coming... solaris 10 update 4 will have it
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:26): i wonder if Sun will come out with 'encapulation' simialr to vxFS, or just have root disks as ZFS for future installs
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:26): man, solaris 10 is going to do some real ass kicking
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:27): Led_Zeppelin, not sure.. i think root disks need to be either single drive or mirrored in a pool, no  bootable zfs on raidz for a while..
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:27): is postgresql integrated into Solaris10? what role is it playing in 5.10 ?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:27): yeap 5 million downloads
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:28): its part of the system.. no real role.. just another package
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:28): like 2x apache, and mysql
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:28): it makes the opensource people happy.
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:28): oh okay, I went to a Solaris conference last week, and the techie said, its going to play a 'role' in Solaris 10.
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:28): Led_Zeppelin, only in marketing...
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:28): maybe they were talking out of her ass :-)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:29): they are allready using sqlite for SMF
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:29): i don't think they need another database in the system
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:29): SMF = "registry" right?
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:29): or hardware and other stuff.
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:29): AIX has the ODM for it...I guess sun has to get something too :-)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:29): its the replacement for   /etc/init.d and /etc/rcX.d  stuff
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:30): Zoning what another big topic...
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:30): its just like Xen for me.

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:30): it will keep services running.. if  a service fails it will automaticly restart, so no 3 am pages.. and if hardware fails  software that is linked to the hardware disabled
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:31): what, you don't like those 2am calls?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:31): zoning is beter in many ways than xen... patch once use,   and all zones are patched
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:31): and the 4 hour, call back, if there is a hardware failure... :-)
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:31): in xen you get  X times the work
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:31): true. but the concept seems the same though
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:32): with global zone = host os in xen
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:32): its only for services... not for global user data, /etc still exists for that and is not going away
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:32): Led_Zeppelin, yes.. but if you want  to have  3 vhosts in xen you get to patch 3 times..
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:32): there is still another 'database' for hardware...
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:33): jamesd: true, since they all use a different kernel.

7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:34): yeap.. xen has its place..  but i prefer to run zones, than xen.. i really want to have windows support in xen or  vmware on top of solaris  then life would be good
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:34): with zfs, is it the end of vxfs?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (10:35): i would say so.. the only thing that vxfs does that zfs doesn't is shrink a  volume...  but who ever needs less storage space
04e766fff64c9657fd27c803b6190ba4 (10:35): thats an important feature, IMO. Flexibility.
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (10:35): forget Xen..  LDOMS
aa939d032327c8399cf2851d5b0201ed (10:36): vxfs has been dead for years, just some ppl havent realised it yet
c84247cefeb3a07c65c26753231e17f7 (10:36): it wouldbe very nice to have for migrating from smaller disks to larger one sin a chassis, like rip some out, then add bigger ones back
